content.description: Sit start sideways underneath the overhang. Feet paste on up high. Left hand starts on good rail and right on a small pinch. Huck for the jug about 4 feet off the ground. Swing out and grab some small crimps to hidden pocket in a sloping rail. Match and top out. If you start from the jug it goes at V4. Fun tricky line.
content.location: Right most line on the boulder. Starts in overhang underneath the boulder and supporting boulder.

content.description: This is a super unique line. Sure it's a lowball, but it is one of the best lines in the park. Sit start on a low rail. Find a heel and a toe, bump right hand to a slightly worse crimp, and toss for the lip. Topout is tricky but not bad.
content.location: This problem is on the South side of the boulder with a slight overhang. You'll see a clean face with a rail and a single crimp.

content.description: Start with one hand in the obvious, large hole and the other on a good crimp. Make a few moves up the slight slab and top out. Fun beginner line.
content.location: Find the dynamite hole on the main face of the boulder.

content.description: Reed Rombough developed this area in 2015. The reason it is named the Dynamite Boulder is because there is a 4 inch in diameter hole in the rock, which the miners would have drilled in order to blow up the rock into smaller pieces. This boulder houses 3 great problems. They are low balls, but the movement is incredible.
